data.title: Mailing it in
data.text: I came here with my wife and daughter.  My wife had a pesto pizza and I had the spaghetti with meat balls.  The pizza was made from a frozen crust and the spaghetti was just okay.  My daughter had Chicken Parm with spaghetti.  The chicken was stringy and old.  I have to say the portions are huge.  The staff was not very friendly.  There are many options in the area, so I would recommend passing by Cafe Lucca.

data.title: Always a delight
data.text: Cafe Luca, located in delightful downtown old town Orange is often a place of refreshment for us after we've walked the streets of this turn of the century area with its historical backdrop. They boast a nice variety of menu items for a casual yet slightly upscale feel. It has a cafe touch but one you might find in Italy ( we've been there). Sometimes we'll stop for dinner but very often drop by just for dessert where they feature a nice collection of wonderful gelato! A nice rich cup of coffee and delicious gelato often top off a nice trip to Downtown Orange!

data.title: Ambience is beautiful with food to back it up
data.text: The staff here is so welcoming and it is a beautiful place to dine.  I am from New Mexico and was surprise that their penne arrabiata was hot (spicy) enough for my palatte.  If you are looking for a quiet atmosphere with good service Café Lucca is the place.

data.title: Excellent breakfast
data.text: Cafe Lucca has a great breakfast selection with fresh baked goods.  I like their oatmeal.  They also have a good selection of gelato.

data.title: Wonderful homemade ravioli
data.text: We sat outside in a very enjoyable nook. The dishes were above average, including the Kobe burger. My mushroom soup (the cup was more a bowl) was delicious and the homemade wild mushroom raviolis were superb. I would definitely go again.

data.title: Homey, Welcoming Cafe with Good Food and Wonderful Gelato
data.text: My daughter and I visit Orange, CA yearly, and Old Town Orange is walkable from where we stay.  It has become tradition for us to go to Café Lucca at least once each visit.  Cafe Lucca is just off the circle in the center of Orange.  It's not outstanding food, but it is good.  The staff is friendly and helpful, even when we walk in with 14 people and need to push tables together.  We always feel we can stay as long as we want, and always finish off the meal with a small (which is bigger than it seems!) gelato.

data.title: My Local Coffee Spot Since 2005
data.text:
I've been a fan, friend, and a regular at "Lucca's" since moving to Old Towne Orange in 2005, and I've yet to find another local coffeehouse/restaurant with as great a staff and such an appealing selection of food and beverages. I'm a huge coffee fan, so most of my income gets spent at the espresso machine. Other visits find me sampling (and traveling home with) an arm load of fresh gelato (made on the premises). If it's meal time I'll grab a table out front so I can people watch with one of their scrambles, multi-grain toast, and that delicious java. 

If you're frequenting that ubiquitous chain-coffee outlet with the mermaid, you're missing the essence of Old Towne. Give Cafe Lucca a chance next time you're in town, and figure out why the experience here can't be manufactured elsewhere.

data.title: Not impressed but gelato was good
data.text: 4 of us were here for lunch. DH had the Italian-type sandwich and thought it was too salty. No chips come with the sandwich, either. Who serves a sandwich without chips?? No pickle either, just the sandwich.  My sandwich came on a small baguette, again, no chips. Sandwich was ok, somewhat dry. Friend had the calamari and declared it fine, other friend had the salad which looked delicious. Bill was $66 before tip, just too much for mediocre lunch. The gelato was good though...no cheap but good.

data.title: Not bad for a birthday
data.text: I took my girlfriend here as part of her birthday celebration. The food and the service was very good but the ambiance was lacking. With the counter that serves gelato off to the side, it detracts from the overall experience. Do not make this a formal dinner, but a good meal with good company and you won't be disappointed.

data.title: Salted Caramel Gelato
data.text: We didn't eat a meal here, but BOY did we get Gelato!  The salted caramel and tiramisu gelato were out of this world!  My boyfriend and I eat alot of ice cream (I have an uncontrollable sweet tooth) and this was some of the best gelato I've ever had!!

data.title: Eggs Benedict is the thing to order
data.text: My lunch companion and I had heard that the thing to buy at Cafe Lucca was the eggs Benedict and so we wanted to give that a try.  When we sat down and expressed that thought to the waiter, he had a quizzical look on his face and then said "I think that they stop serving breakfast about 11:00, but let me ask for you".   We were so happy when he returned and said that they would still make that dish for us, even though it was now about 12:30.  There are three or four different types available and I got the one with turkey and avocado whereas my date had the one with crab cakes.  They were both very good.

data.title: Yumz!
data.text: This by far one of my favorite places in old town Orange! I could eat here everyday. Really. The food is amazing. period. Salads, pasta, pizza, soups and don't forget the gelato. All are fantastic. You won't be disappointed.

data.title: My favorite place to grade papers
data.text: the staff are wonderful and know the regulars. The food is delicious, but I most enjoy the soups--hearty, tasty--and the breakfasts. Nice selection. Just enough for choice and weird moods, but not enough to overwhelm.

data.title: Eat somewhere else
data.text:
We went here to celebrate a friend's birthday.   BIG MISTAKE!   3 of us ordered the winter omelette which has sausage in it but when our dish arrived NO SAUSAGE.   All of our omelettes!    We called one of the servers ( the one with a beard and mustache ) and pointed out that all our winter omelettes were missing the main ingredient, the sausage!   (The thing is, our friend who recommended this place had the winter omelette before and she was the one who said there's no sausage in her omelette .  Come to find out, all of our omelettes don't have any sausage.). 
The server who came over looked at our omelettes, and I already practically dissected my omelette looking for that elusive sausage and he pointed to a spec of something and said,  "there that's a sausage".  ARE YOU KIDDING ME!!!!!!  
Then he asked us, would you like some more sausage?   DUH!   We didn't even get any!   Then he gives us the smallest ramekin with sausage (hello there's 3 of us that ordered that winter omelette).   I wanted to say, now this is the missing sausage!   By this time I have completely lost my appetite.

I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND CAFE LUCCA TO ANYONE AND WOULD NEVER COME BACK HERE.

data.title: Flavorful Gelato
data.text: Had this place on my radar for awhile and finally stopped by to try their Gelato.  I was very impressed, and very satisfied.  They had many flavors to choose from, and you could try a sample of the ones that you might be interested in.  Some interesting flavors too, such as Churro, Capn' Crunch, Lavender and Blueberry just to name a few.  I was torn between the Key Lime Pie, and the Capn' Crunch, as well as the Tropical Punch.  They were busy and had quite a line when we went it but it was worth the wait.  The Gelato was delicious!  Will go here again that is for sure...

data.title: Gelato!!!
data.text:
The gelato is good, I had better... 
Very expensive,the little tiny cups $4.99 better value the larger container for$ 12.00

data.title: Sunday breakfast
data.text: The 3 stars are for the Bloody Mary and the fresh coffee. Dry french toast and cold sausage gets a zero. Service was good. Price too high for the quality of food.

data.title: Almost excellent breakfast...
data.text:
Had breakfast meeting, and tried this cafe.  Overall good experience, in a nutshell:

Good - the coffee, served in huge cups!
Variety of foods on menu.
Clean environs.
Caring service.
Fruit cup was very fresh!!

Cons -
Benedict ham was dry, and there was not enough hollandaise sauce to help...

I would try again to see if this was just off day.

data.title: Best Little Place in Town !
data.text: If you are looking for a great place to have lunch then Lucca is the spot!  Clean ,fast, fun and efficient.  Great menu, wonderful staff.

data.title: Great Restaurant in Orange - Friendly and Moderately Priced
data.text:
We go to Cafe Lucca on a regular basis for either breakfast or lunch - I joke that they should put our names on a couple of the chairs.

Their Hearty Tuscan soup is one of my favorites, along with the Sicilian or San Remo sandwich. The Kobe beef burger is also very good.  For breakfast, my favorites are the Summer Omelette and the Breakfast Wrap.

We've gotten to know the wait staff and have always found them to be friendly and attentive.  

Prices are modest, especially compared to some of the other restaurants in the area.

In summary, I recommend Cafe Lucca if you're in the Orange, California area.
